ingredientList:
4-6 bell peppers use any color – green, yellow, red, orange
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 lb ground beef - you can also use ground turkey, chicken, pork, sausage
1 medium onion chopped
1 jalapeno pepper chopped (optional, for spicy)
5 cloves garlic chopped
14.5 ounces fire roasted tomatoes (canned - or use diced tomatoes)
1 cup shredded cheese cheddar, mozzarella, or a blend
1 tablespoon paprika
1 teaspoon dried oregano
1 teaspoon dried basil
Salt and pepper to taste
1 cup cooked rice white, brown, or wild rice
For Garnish. Fresh chopped parsley, red pepper flakes
recipeText:
Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C) and bring a pot of water (enough to cover the bell peppers) to a boil.

2. Wash the bell peppers, cut off the tops, and scoop out the insides. If needed, slice a small part off the bottom of the peppers so they will stand upright. (NOTE: Chop the extra bell pepper tops to cook later with the onion - discard the stem.)

3. Blanch the bell peppers for 5 minutes to slightly soften. (Alternative, you can roast the peppers for 20 minutes to soften).

4. Set the softened peppers into a lightly oiled baking dish.

5. Heat the oil in a large pan to medium heat and add the onions, chopped pepper tops, and jalapeno (if using). Cook for 5 minutes to soften.

6. Add the garlic and cook 1 minute, or until the garlic becomes fragrant.

7. Add the ground beef and cook 5-6 minutes, breaking apart as you go, until cooked through.

8. Add the fire roasted tomatoes, seasonings, and cooked rice. Stir together and remove from heat.

9. Stir in half of the shredded cheese until incorporated.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/4 cup sugar
1/3 cup melted butter
16 ounces cream cheese, softened (use 8 oz for less flavor)
1/4 cup sugar
2 tablespoons milk
8 ounces cool whip
2 3 1/2-ounce boxes chocolate instant pudding & pie filling mix (8 servings)
3 1/2 cups milk
8 ounces mini semisweet chocolate chips
recipeText:
Combine crumbs, 1 1/2 cup sugar, and melted butter.  Press firmly into bottom of 13x9 inch baking pan; chill 5 minutes.  For firmer crust, bake at 375 degrees for 8 minutes, cool.  

Beat cream cheese with 1/4 cup sugar & 2 TBSP milk until smooth.  Fold in half of the whipped topping.  Spread over crust.  

Prepare pudding using 3 1/3 cup milk.  Pour pudding over cream cheese layer.  Chill several hours or overnight.  

Spread remaining whipped topping over pudding.  Sprinkle chocolate chips on top to garnish.

recipeName: Slow Cooker Garlic Parmesan Chicken Stew
ingredientList:
1 lb red potatoes (cut into 1⁄2" pieces)
2 large carrots (peeled and thinly sliced)
1⁄2 medium onion (finely chopped)
3 cloves garlic (minced)
1 1⁄2 teaspoon salt*
1 teaspoon dried parsley
1 teaspoon Italian seasoning
1⁄2 teaspoon black pepper
1 1⁄2 cups low sodium chicken or vegetable broth
2 tablespoons corn starch
2⁄3 cup heavy cream
3 boneless skinless chicken breasts (about 1.5 lb)
1 cup frozen peas (optional)
1⁄3 cup shredded Parmesan cheese
recipeText:
1. Place the potatoes, carrots, onion, garlic, salt, parsley, Italian seasoning, and pepper in a 4- to 6-quart slow cooker and stir.

2. In a small bowl, whisk together the broth and cornstarch and add to the slow cooker along with the cream. 

3. Cut the chicken and stir into the liquid. 

4. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 7 hours, or until the potatoes are tender. (This could take longer, depending on the temperature of your slow cooker. If you want to reduce the cooking time, cut the potatoes smaller.)

5. Add the peas and Parmesan, then taste and adjust seasonings as desired.

6. Serve immediately. I recommend crusty bread for dipping —the best way!

recipeText:
How to make Bacon Wrapped Smokies with Brown Sugar add butter

Preheat oven 375 degrees.

Cut bacon into thirds and wrap each smokie in a slice of bacon.

Place the wrapped smokies in a single layer in a baking dish.

Melt stick of butter and mix with 1 cup Brown Sugar. Stir until mixed well.

Pour the butter and brown sugar mixture on the smokies and bacon.

Sprinkle the remaining 1 cup of brown sugar evenly over the smokies.

Bake for about 18 -20 minutes at 375 degrees. 

Then turn the heat up to 400 degrees and bake for about 5 minutes until the bacon becomes crispy.

4 bars Hershey's chocolate
recipeText:
Mix crackers, powdered sugar, and margarine.  Press in a 12" x 7-1/4" cookie sheet pan.  Bake at 325 degrees for 10 minutes.

Mix coconut and sweetened condensed milk.  Spread on hot crust, bake 10 minutes.

Melt the chocolate chips and chocolate bars.

Spread on hot coconut mix.

Sprinkle with almonds, if desired.

ingredientList:
2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/2 cup melted butter
1/4 cup sugar
3 cups coconut
1 can sweetened condensed milk
1 tablespoon peanut butter
1 package semisweet chocolate chips
recipeText:
Mix cracker crumbs, sugar, and butter and press hard in a 9" x 13" pan. 
Bake 10 minutes at 350 degrees. 

Mix together coconut and condensed milk and pour over crust. 
Bake for an additional 15 minutes at 350 degrees. 

Melt chocolate chips. Add peanut butter. Pour mixture over the top of the bars. 
Cool and eat!

ingredientList:
1 (12-ounce) bag semisweet chocolate chips
1 (12-ounce) bag butterscotch chips
1 1/2 cups peanut butter
1 cup miniature marshmallows
1 cup peanuts (optional: pecans or walnuts)
recipeText:
Melt the peanut butter, chocolate and butterscotch chips.  

Mix in marshmallows and peanuts.  

Pour into a 9" x 13" pan.  

Cool, cut, and eat.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups boiling water
1 cup oatmeal
1/2 cup margarine
1 cup brown sugar
1 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Frosting:
1/2 cup butter or margarine
1 cup brown sugar, packed
1 tablespoon milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup coconut
1/2 cup chopped nuts
recipeText:
Pour boiling water over oatmeal and let stand for 20 minutes.  Cream sugar and margarine, beat in eggs, and sifted dry ingredients all at once.  

Add vanilla and beat.  Add oatmeal and water and blend well.  Bake on greased cookie sheet at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

Frosting:  Boil frosting ingredients except coconut and nuts.  Blend in coconut and nuts and spread on cake while it is still hot.  Cool and Cut.

ingredientList:
1 box orange jello
1 box instant vanilla pudding
1 cup boiling water
1/2 cup cold water
1 cool whip 8-oz
1 cup mini marshmallows
1 can mandarin oranges 14-oz
recipeText:
In a large bowl combine orange jello and boiling water.

Whisk until jello is dissolved.

Add cold water and allow to chill for 15 minutes in refrigerator.

Slowly whisk in vanilla pudding, mix until smooth, and chill for another 15-20 minutes or until it becomes slightly thickened.

Fold in cool whip, mandarin oranges and Marshmallows.

ingredientList:
1 cup corn syrup
1 cup sugar
1 cup peanut butter
6 cups crispy rice cereal
1 cup salted peanuts
1 10-ounce package M&M's
recipeText:
Grease a 9" x 13" pan with butter.

Combine syrup and sugar and peanut butter in a pan.  Heat until melted stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.

Add cereal, peanuts, and M&M's.  Pat into the pan..

ingredientList:
1/2 cup corn syrup
1/2 cup sugar
3/4 cup peanut butter
3 cups crispy rice cereal
1 package semisweet chocolate chips
1/2 package butterscotch chips
recipeText:
Combine syrup and sugar in a pan.  Heat until melted.  Don't boil!  Remove from heat.

Add peanut butter and mix throughly.  

Fold in cereal and pat into a buttered pan.  

Melt the chips and pour over top.

ingredientList:
Dough:
2 3 Oz Package cream cheese
1/2 pound butter
2 cups flour

Filling:
1 3/4 Cup light brown sugar
2 eggs
2 Tablespoons butter
1 Teaspoon Vanilla
pinch of salt
1 cup pecans, chopped
recipeText:
Grease tart pans lightly. Cream butter and cream cheese, add flour and mix well.

Roll dough out to about 1/4 in thick or slightly less.

Cut into fluted or plain cookie cutter and put into small tart pan.

Put about 1/2 teaspoon chopped pecans into each tart.

Beat eggs slightly with fork. Melt butter and add sugar, salt, and vanilla to the eggs.

Put 3/4 teaspoon filling into each tart, on top of chopped nuts. Add a few pecans on top of filling.

Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 Minutes.

Let cool before removing from pan.

ingredientList:
1 package Pecan Frosting Mix
3 cups rolled oats
1 cup margarine
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
3/4 cup peanut butter
recipeText:
See the Pecan Frosting Mix Substitute recipe.

Mix frosting mix, oats, and margarine.  Press in a bar pan and bake for 15 to 20 minutes at 350 degrees.

Melt chocolate chips and peanut butter.  Spread on bars while they are still warm.

recipeName: Pillsbury Bake Off 1975 - Pecan Frosting Mix Substitute
recipeDescription: This recipe can be used as a substitution for a box of Pecan Frosting Mix.
ingredientList:
1 cup sweetened flaked coconut
3/4 cup brown sugar, firmly packed
1/2 cup flour
1/2 cup chopped pecans
3 tablespoons butter or margarine
recipeText:
In medium bowl, combine coconut, brown sugar, flour, and pecans; mix well. 

Using fork or pastry blender cut in butter or margarine.

ingredientList:
MIX
1 1/4 cups chopped dates
1 cup hot water
let cool
Beat till creamy
1 cup soft butter
1 1/4 cups sugar
2 eggs
Sift and stir in gradually
1 3/4 cups flour
1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
Stir in date mixture
1 tsp vanilla
1/2 cup choc chips
1/2 cup chopped walnuts
recipeText:
Mix chopped dates with hot water, let cool.

Beat butter, sugar, and eggs until creamy.

Sift and gradually stir the flour and baking soda into the egg mixture.

Add in the date mixture.

Spread in greased 15' x 10' pan.

Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or in two smaller pans for 20 minutes.

Top with chocolate chips and nuts.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup butter or margarine
2 cups vanilla wafers, crushed
1 cup coconut
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips or butterscotch chips.
1 cup nuts
1 14-ounce can sweetened condensed milk
recipeText:
Melt the butter in a 8" x 12" pan.  On the melted butter, put the crushed wafers.  Then top with the remaining ingredients in the order given.  Do not mix. 

Bake at 325 degrees for 25 minutes.  Cut when cool.

ingredientList:
14 cups Rice Krispies cereal
2 10-ounce bag of marshmallows
1/2 cup margarine
1 can sweetened condensed milk
1 package Kraft caramels
1/2 cup butter
recipeText:
Melt margarine and marshmallows. Mix in Rice Krispies.

Spread half of the mixture in a 9x13 buttered pan.

Cook butter, caramel, and sweetened condensed milk.

Put caramel mixture over Rice Krispies.

Put other half of Krispies mixture over caramel mixture.

recipeDescription: From Beverly Wellmann.  These are very good.
ingredientList:
1 cup dates, finely chopped
1 cup chopped nuts (doesn't say what kind)
1 can eagle brand condensed milk
1 box Ritz crackers

Frosting: 
1 Stick butter
2 cups powdered sugar
1teaspoon vanilla 
milk
recipeText:
Put dates and milk in double boiler--cook about 8-10 minutes or until mixture thicken. 
Take off heat and add nuts (internet recipes seem to all agree on pecans). 
Cover each Ritz cracker with the mixture.
Bake at 300 to 325 degrees for 5-10- minutes, cool.


Mix butter, powdered sugar, and vanilla.  Add enough milk to spread the frosting.

Makes 5 dozen. Freezes well.

ingredientList:
1 jar 16-oz roasted peanuts
4 tablespoons butter or margarine
Add
12 ounces package peanut butter chips
Stir until melted
Add
1 cup sweetened condensed milk
let cool some
Add
1 package miniature marshmallows
recipeText:
Spray a 9 x 13 pan with non-stick cooking spray.

Spread half the peanuts on the pan.

Melt butter in a pan, add peanut butter chips and stir until melted.

Add sweetened condensed milk.  Let the mixture cool some and then add miniature marshmallows.

Mix together and pour over peanuts. 

Press in pan and sprinkle rest of peanuts on top. Refrigerate and cut into bars.

ingredientList:
1 (7-ounce) jar marshmallow creame
2 1/4 cups powdered sugar
3 tablespoons water
17 ounces caramels
16 ounces bag peanuts
recipeText:
Knead together the Marshmallow cream and Powdered sugar.
Shape into small fingers.
Place on wax paper-lined cookie sheet and freeze.

Melt caramel with water over double boiler (or microwave).
Dip cream fingers in caramel mixture then roll in chopped peanuts.

Freeze until set.
Store in the refrigerator or freeze.

ingredientList:
1 cup Rice Krispies
1 cup sugar
1 cup light corn syrup
1 1/2 cups peanut butter
Frosting
1 6-oz bag milk chocolate chips
1 6-oz bag butterscotch chips
recipeText:
Melt peanut butter, karo syrup and sugar over low beat until smooth. add Rice Krispies and toss until well coated. Press mixture into greased 9 x 13 pan.

Melt mil chocolate chips and butterscotch chips until smooth when stirred. Pour over Rice Krispies, spread to cover. Chill. Cut into squares.

ingredientList:
3 cups flour
1 cup margarine
1 package dry yeast
3 egg yolk beaten
6 tablespoons milk
1 tablespoon sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract

FILLING:
1 pound ground walnuts
1 cup sugar
Put in milk to moisten 
dash of cinnamon
recipeText:
Sprinkle yeast on 2 Tablespoon warm water and let stand for 5 minutes, mix. 
Cut margarine into flour. Mix well. Add yeast mixture and next 4 ingredients. 
Make into 9 balls and chill overnight.

NEXT DAY, make the filling.  Roll out dough ( 1 ball at a time) in powder sugar into either a circle or a rectangle. Then cut pieces into squares and triangles.

Put a dab of nut filling in the center of each piece and roll pieces. put on lightly greased cookie sheet.

Bake about 15 minutes at 350 degrees.

Dip in powdered sugar and let cool.

Nut rolls can be frozen.

ingredientList:
1 cup butter
1 cup brown sugar
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 3/4 cups oats
1 3/4 cups flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 cups raisins
1/2 cup water
4 egg yolks
1 cup sour cream
3 tablespoons cornstarch
1 1/2 cups sugar
1 cup half and half
1 tablespoon butter or margarine
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Mix the ingredients from the butter to the salt.  Put half of the crumbs in a 15" x 11" cookie sheet or jelly roll pan.  Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.  

Cook raisins in water until tender.  Add remaining ingredients, except vanilla, and cook until thick.  

Add the vanilla.  Pour filling on top of the crust; then sprinkle the remaining crust mixture on top.  Bake at 350 degrees for 15 - 20 minutes.

recipeName: Sour Cream Raisin Bars - Shellie Kahler
ingredientList:
Crust:
1 3/4 cups flour
1 cup butter
1 cup brown sugar
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 3/4 cups oatmeal


Filling:
1 1/2 cups sugar
4 egg yolks, beaten
3 tablespoons cornstarch
1 3/4 cups skim milk, soured by adding a little vinegar 
2 1/2 raisins
recipeText:
Mix all crust ingredients except butter.  Cut butter into the crust mixture (like making pie crust).
Save 1 1/2 cups of the crust mixture for the topping.
Pat remaining mixture into a 9 X 13 pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes.

Mix together sugar, egg yolks, cornstarch, milk and raisins.
In heavy sauce pan, boil over low heat for 10 minutes.
Pour over baked crust.

Put remaining crumb topping over mixture. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees.

recipeName: Calico Bean Bake - Jan from Oak Hills
recipeDescription: Jan from Oak Hills - Very Good Cook
ingredientList:
1 pound ground beef or Pork (I Use Pork, Juicier)
1 cup chopped onions
1/2 pound chopped bacon
1/2 cup ketchup
3/4 cup brown sugar
2 teaspoons vinegar
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon dry mustard
1 pound 12 oz pork and beans
1 pound can butter beans
1 pound can kidney beans
recipeText:
Brown meat, cut up bacon, and onions in skillet. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. 

Bake in Casserole, uncovered at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

I put in a crockpot on low for several hours stirring several times.

Crock Pot works just as well or even better, than baking in oven.

ingredientList:
2 10 3/4-ounce cans cream of mushroom soup
1 cup milk
2 teaspoons soy sauce
1/4 teaspoon black pepper
8 cups cooked cut green beans
2 2/3 cups French-fried onions
recipeText:
In a 3 qt casserole bowl, mix all ingredients except 2/3 cup onions.  

Bake 350 degrees for 25 minutes, or until hot.  

Stir.  Top with remaining onions.  Bake 5 more minutes.

ingredientList:
2 cans French green beans, drained
1 can French Fried onions rings
1 can cream of mushroom soup
recipeText:
Pour one can of green beans and 1/2 can French Fried Onions Rings into a casserole dish.  

Next layer another can beans. Then pour 1 can cream of mushroom soup over top. 

Bake covered at 350 degrees for about 25 minutes. 

For the last 10 minutes, put other 1/2 can onion rings over casserole and return to the oven uncovered.

ingredientList:
2 Great northern navy beans
30 oz catsup
1 Tsp soda
1 cup brown sugar
2 tsp vinegar
3 pounds Ham
Salt pepper to taste
1 To 2 tablespoon mustard
recipeText:
Wash beans, then soak overnight with 1 Tbsp Soda and 1 Tablespoons vinegar.

Next Day: drain off water add clean water and pre cook beans on top of stove until foam pretty much stops foaming.
Spoon foam off then add ham and fat pieces; you need quit alot of fat of each. 

1--to 2 Tablespoon Mustard,
1--2 tablespoon vinegar
one 32 oz bottle of catsup
1 cup brown sugar
Salt and pepper



Start at 400 until beans are hot then turn down to 250 or 300 degrees.

It may need more brown sugar- I add 1/4 cup at a time it takes 5 to 6 hours to make there.

Mix very carefully and rather often or it stick to bottom and sides.

recipeDescription:
This is the best recipe we have.  Grandpa added a little of this and a little of that.
It is very hard to know exactly how he made his beans.
ingredientList:
2 pounds navy beans
1 tablespoon baking soda
1 tablespoon vinegar
1 pound ham pieces and fat
1 pound bacon pieces (not sure if he used this ingredient)
1-2 tablespoons mustard
1-2 tablespoons vinegar
1 32-ounce bottle ketchup
1 cup brown sugar
recipeText:
Wash beans, cover with water, mixed with baking soda and 1 tablespoon vinegar.  Soak overnight.

Next day, drain off water.  Add fresh water and cook beans on stove-top until beans stop foaming and are about 2/3 done.  Spoon off any foam.

Add ham pieces and fat (and bacon pieces if used).  Add mustard, extra vinegar, ketchup, and brown sugar.  

Heat oven to 400 degrees and bake beans in large pan.  When oven reaches 400 degrees, turn down to 250 degrees - 300 degrees.

Cook for 5-6 hours, stirring often.   You may add more brown sugar to taste.

recipeName: Grandpa Kuntz's Baked Beans - In Grandma's Handwriting
ingredientList:
4 pounds navy beans
3 teaspoons salt
1 teaspoon pepper
1/2 cup brown sugar
1 quart tomato juice
2 cups water
2 pounds cut up ham or pork pieces and fat
1/2 cup molasses
Ketchup, to taste
recipeText:
Wash beans, cover with water, (mixed with baking soda and 1 tablespoon vinegar -- this isn't in Grandma's recipe but is supposed to help reduce gas) Soak overnight.

Next day, drain off water.  Add fresh water and cook beans on stove-top until beans stop foaming and are about 2/3 done.  Spoon off any foam.

Add remaining ingredients and bake in medium oven until done.

ingredientList:
2/3 cup sour cream
2/3 cup sour milk
1 cup sugar
3 eggs
3 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
2 teaspoons baking powder
Pinch salt
1 teaspoon nutmeg
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
If you don't have sour cream or sour milk, add 1 tablespoon of vinegar to the cup of milk or cream.  

Whip sour cream and sour milk.  Add sugar.  Add eggs one at a time while beating.  

Sift together flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.  Fold into mixture.  Add nutmeg and vanilla.  

Chill for several hours.  Don't chill too long or the dough gets too thick and won't come out of the doughnut maker. 

Deep fat fry.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups diced apples, peeled 2 to 3 Apples
1 cup flour
1/4 cup sugar
1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1/3 cup milk
1 egg
2 tablespoons sugar
1 teaspoon cinnamon
Oil for frying

Glaze:
1 1/2 cups powdered sugar
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 tablespoons milk
in a small bowl, Mix glaze ingredients and drizzle
over fritters
recipeText:
In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, and baking powder.  In a separate bowl, mix milk and egg, then add it into dry ingredients.
Mix until just combined ( Mix will be thick).

In a separate bowl, toss the apple chunks with the cinnamon and sugar.   Add apples into batter and stir just to coat apples.

Heat fryer to 350 degrees.
Drop by heaping Tablespoons into oil. (Use a second spoon to help drop batter from first spoon.) 

Fry for 3-4 minutes.
Use a fork or tongs to flip over 1/2 way through frying.

Place fried fritters on a cooling rack with paper towels placed beneath the cooling rack.

ingredientList:
3 bananas
1 cup sugar
2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 cup shortening
1/2 cup walnuts
recipeText:
Mash bananas and mix with sugar.  Let stand 15 minutes.  Add the rest of the ingredients (except walnuts) and beat thoroughly.  Mix in walnuts.  

Bake in greased bread pan at 325 degrees for 50 - 60 minutes, or in cupcake tins for 20 minutes.

ingredientList:
3 cups soft bread crumbs (6 slices of bread)
2 cups milk
1/2 cup sugar
2 eggs
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup raisins
Sugar and cinnamon mixture
recipeText:
Spray 9x9x2 inch baking dish with non-stick spray.  Mix all ingredients together.  Pour mixture into dish, sprinkle top with cinnamon and sugar.  

Bake 40-45 minutes, at 350 degrees, or until knife inserted comes out clean.  Serve with ice cream.

ingredientList:
2 packages dry yeast
1 cup sugar
2 cups luke warm water
1 cup vegetable oil
2 teaspoons salt
4 eggs
9 cups flour
2 tablespoons butter
recipeText:
Mix yeast and sugar in 2 cups of luke-warm water.  Add oil, salt, and eggs. Then slowly add flour.

For dark buns, use 3 cups of dark flour and 5 to 6 cups of white flour.

Let dough double in size then punch down and rise again. Roll into balls for buns, put butter on top and let rise.

Bake at 350 degrees for about 10 minutes.  Bake until golden brown.  Baking time will depend on how large the buns are.

You can use this dough for sweet rolls and caramel rolls.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups sugar
3/4 cup margarine
3 eggs, beaten
3 large bananas (1 cup mashed)
3 cups flour
1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
10 ounces maraschino cherries
1/4 cup cherry juice
1/4 cup walnuts
6 ounces semisweet chocolate chips
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients (except cherries) together, slowly mix in cherries, pour mixture into 2 bread loaf pans.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

For a healthier twist:
Use 3/4 cup apple sauce instead of margarine.
Use 2 1/2 cups flour and 1/2 cup oats instead of 3 cups of flour.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 pounds blanched whole almonds
1 pound brazil nuts
1/2 pound walnuts halves
1/2 pound pecans halves
1 1/2 pounds pitted dates
1/3 pound red candied cherries
1/3 pound green candied cherries
1 cup flour
1 cup white sugar
1 teaspoon baking powder
3/4 teaspoon salt
4 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 275 degrees.  Line two 5 x 9 inch loaf pans with greased parchment paper.

Combine the almonds, Brazil nuts, walnuts, pecans, dates, red and green cherries; mix well.

Sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.  Combine with nut mixture and mix well.

Beat eggs and vanilla, add to nut and flour mixture and mix well.

Press into 2 lined loaf pans.

Bake for 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Set aside for 5 minutes, then remove from pans.

Completely cool on wire rack.

recipeName: Cinnamon Bread Pudding with Butter Sauce
ingredientList:
6 eggs
1 3/4 cups half and half or light cream
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
2 cups milk
1 cup sugar
6 cups cubed cinnamon bread or rolls

Butter Sauce:
1/2 cup brown sugar
1/4 cup butter
1/3 cup light corn syrup
1/4 cup half and half or light cream
recipeText:
Beat eggs, milk, 1 3/4 cups cream, 1 cup sugar, and vanilla until combined.  Stir in cinnamon bread.  Grease a 2-quart baking dish.  Add bread pudding mixture, spreading evenly.  

Bake at 325 degrees for 55 - 60 minutes until the top is puffed and a knife inserted comes out clean.  

Butter Sauce: 
In a small saucepan, heat brown sugar and 1/4 cup butter.  Carefully add 1/3 cup light corn syrup and 1/4 cup cream.  
Cook 1 to 2 minutes until sugar is dissolved and mixture is smooth.  Serve over warm pudding.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup shortening
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup water
1 cup flour
4 eggs
Heavy cream
recipeText:
Bring shortening and water to a boil.  Stir in sifted flour and salt slowly.  Beat constantly until mixture leaves sides of pan and form into a ball (about 4 minutes).

Remove from heat and cool.  Add 4 eggs, one at a time, beating until smooth after each egg addition.  

Drop spoonfuls onto greased baking sheet.

Bake at 400 degrees for 45 - 50 minutes. 

Cool and fill with whipped cream.  Can also use ice cream or sweetened fruit. 

Makes 12 big cream puffs.  Can make small ones (bake for about 25 minutes).

recipeDescription: Family Favorite. Grandma Lendt made these.
ingredientList:
1/4 cup warm water
1 package dry yeast
1/4 cup sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
1/6 cup shortening
1 egg
3/8 cup warm milk
2 cups flour
3/4 cup raisins

GLAZE:
2 cups powdered sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/4 cup milk
recipeText: Soak yeast in warm water, combine sugar, salt, nutmeg, shortening, egg, and milk. Add yeast mixture to half of the flour. Beat 2 minutes. Add the rest of the flour, beat 2 more minutes. Scrape batter down and add raisins. Let stand 45 minutes and drop by teaspoonfuls into hot fat, 385 degrees. Glaze while warm.

ingredientList:
1 cup water
1 stick butter
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup flour
4 eggs

Filling:
1 pint heavy cream
1 package 3.4 ounces instant vanilla pudding
1/3 cup milk
recipeText:
Bring water, butter and vanilla to a boil add flour. Stir constantly until it leaves the side of the pot and forms a ball.

Remove and let cool.

Beat the eggs, one at a time until smooth. Drop by Tablespoon onto parchment lined cookie sheets. 

Bake at 400 degrees for about 40 minutes.

*Pro tip can poke with a toothpick once out of the oven, then return them to the oven with it shut off and the door cracked open while they cool.  This helps keep them from deflating.

Beat cream, pudding, and milk in a mixer until thick.

Slice puff in half and pipe or scoop in the filling.

Dust with powdered sugar or pour on melted chocolate.

Makes 8 large puffs.

ingredientList:
8 eggs
1/4 cup coconut flour
1/3 cup butter
1 cup coconut milk
1 cup Arrow Root Flour Bob's Red Mill
recipeText:
Mix ingredients.

Place in a 9 x 13 Glass Pan or muffin tins.

Bake at  425 degrees for 15-20 minutes.

ingredientList:
pre-packaged pie crust
3 egg
1 cup sugar
1 small package cottage cheese
butter
cinnamon
recipeText:
Put pie crust in bottom of pan.

Beat eggs and sugar until creamy.  Add cottage cheese.  Pour over pie crust.

Sprinkle with butter and cinnamon.

Bake. Turn oven down to 325 degrees and bake until center of kuka is firm.  Watch crust so it does not burn.

ingredientList:
Sweet Dough Crust:
1 cup water Temp Per Yeast Instructions
1 egg
1/4 cup sugar
1 package Rapid Rise yeast
3 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon salt

Filling:
1 cottage cheese
1 1/2 cups sugar
6 eggs
Cinnamon on Top
recipeText: Bake for 1 hour at 325 degrees.

ingredientList:
Crust:
1 package rapid rise yeast
1 cup water (temperature per yeast instructions)
1 egg
1/4 cup sugar
2 tablespoons butter softened
3 1/4 cups flour
1 teaspoon salt

Filling:
1 cottage cheese
1 1/2 cups sugar
6 eggs
recipeText:
Dissolve yeast in water.  Stir in egg, sugar, butter, and salt. Stir in flour.

Knead until dough consistency.

Oil a bowl and put dough in bowl.  Turn the dough over to coat all sides of dough with oil. 

Cover and let rise until double in size (about 1 hour).

Punch down dough, divide into 3 pieces. 

Using rolling pin and flour, roll into circles that will fit into three pie pans.


Use pie crust or sweet bread dough in bottom. 

Blend together the filling ingredients and put on top of dough.

Sprinkle with cinnamon.

Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour or until filling is set.


Can be frozen.

Variation: You can add cooked apples, prunes, or any fruit you would like on top of mixture and then add cinnamon.

ingredientList:
4 cups mashed potatoes I use Potato Buds
1/2 cup shortening I use 1/4 shortening and 1/4 butter
1/2 cup whipped cream
1 tablespoon sugar
1 teaspoon heaping salt
3 cups flour
recipeText:
Combine all ingredients except flour.  Set it in the refrigerator overnight, or make sure it is cooled well or for many hours.

Add the flour and mix well. 

Roll into balls and keep in refrigerator.

Fry at 450 to 500 degrees.

ingredientList:
1 package Pillsbury hot roll mix
3/4 cup warm water
1 egg
3 tablespoons sugar
1 teaspoon maple extract
6 tablespoons margarine or butter, melted
1/2 cup sugar
1 teaspoon maple extract
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/3 cup nuts
1 1/2 cups powdered sugar
1/4 teaspoon maple extract
2 - 3 tablespoons milk
recipeText:
Prepare dough using roll mix, water, egg, 3 tablespoons of sugar, and 1 teaspoon of maple extract.  Let dough rise until light and double size, 30 - 45 minutes.

Filling:  Combine 1/2 cup sugar, cinnamon, 1 teaspoon of maple extract, and nuts.

Divide dough into 3 equal balls.  Roll one out to a 12 inch circle.  Place on greased 12 inch pizza pan.  Brush dough with 2 tablespoons melted butter.  Sprinkle on 1/3 of the filling.  Repeat, layering the dough and filling, ending with filling on top.  

Use a glass to mark a 2-inch circle in the center.  DO NOT CUT!  Now cut 16 wedges just to the circle.  Twist each 3-layer wedge 5 times.  Let rise until double in size, 30 - 45 minutes.

Bake at 375 degrees for 20 - 25 minutes.  

Glaze: mix powdered sugar, 1/4 teaspoon maple extract, and 2 - 3 tablespoons milk.  Drizzle over twists while still warm.

ingredientList:
1 loaf frozen bread dough, thawed
salt
oil
recipeText:
Roll bits of dough into finger size rolls.  

Place on pan, cover, and let them rise for about a 1/2 hour.

Put a little oil (2-3 tablespoons), salt, and water (2-3 tablespoons) in a frying pan.  

Fry on medium-high for 2-3 minutes.  Do not open the lid!  Then turn to low and continue frying until most of the steam escapes. 

Take cover off.  Bottom of noodla should be brown.  Turn noodla over and fry until brown.  

Take from pan, salt, and serve immediately.

ingredientList:
2 eggs
1 cup milk
1 cup flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
recipeText:
Generously grease six 6-ounce custard cups or 8 muffin cups. Set aside.

In large mixing bowl beat eggs. Add remaining ingredients and beat on low speed just until smooth. Fill cups about 3/4 full with batter.

Bake at 400° for 15 minutes, then reduce to 325° and bake for 15 minutes longer, or until deep golden brown.

Remove from pan and serve warm.  Eat with honey.

ingredientList:
1 yellow cake mix
1 package instant coconut pudding, small
4 eggs
3/4 cup hot water
1/2 cup oils
1/4 cup poppy seeds
recipeText:
Mix cake mix, pudding and poppy seeds. Add eggs and oil. Mix well and add hot water. Mix at medium speed for 4 minutes. 

Put in greased loaf pans. 

Bake at 350 degrees for 40 to 45 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups brown sugar
2/3 cup salad oils
1 egg
1 cup sour milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/2 cup nuts
1 teaspoon salt
2 1/2 cups flour
1 1/2 cups diced rhubarb
1 teaspoon baking soda
recipeText:
Mix in order. Pour into 2 greased loaf pans. 
Sprinkle pithy mixture of 1/2 cup sugar and 1 Tablespoon butter for each loaf pan. 
Bake 325 degrees for 40 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups sugar
1 cup buttermilk
2/3 cup vegetable oil
2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1 egg, beaten
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 1/2 cups diced rhubarb
1/2 cup chopped walnuts

TOPPING:
1/4 cup packed brown sugar
1/4 cup chopped nuts
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
recipeText:
In a medium mixing bowl, combine all ingredients except rhubarb, nuts, and topping ingredients. Gently stir in rhubarb and nuts.  

Spoon the batter into 24 greased muffin cups. Combine topping ingredients and sprinkle over tops of muffins. 

Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until muffins test done.

ingredientList:
1 teaspoon sugar
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
1 cup milk
1 cup flour
recipeText:
Use a fork to beat eggs, sugar, and salt. Don't beat too much or they will have too much air in them . 

Add flour. Then slowly add milk while keeping bumps out of the batter.

Heat lard to 350 to 360 degrees.  Put rosette iron into lard and beat. Dip iron into batter, then into lard for frying. 

Fry about 1 minute. 

Frost with powdered sugar and water frosting mixture little vanilla if desired.

ingredientList:
2 cups lukewarm water
1 cup sugar
1/2 cup mazola (corn) oil
2 teaspoons salt
4 eggs, beaten
2 packages dry yeast
2 teaspoons sugar
9 cups flour
Candied Fruit
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients.  Rise until double in size, then punch down and let rise again.

Bake at 350 degrees.  For soft buns, butter top of dough with melted butter before and after baking.

For dark buns, use 3 cups dark flour and 6 cups white flour.

ingredientList:
1 cup butter (2 Sticks), very soft
1 cup powdered sugar
1 cup honey
2 Tsp cinnamon
recipeText: Whip all together.

ingredientList:
1 package yellow cake mix
1 package (3 1/2 ounce)vanilla instant pudding 
3/4 cup oils
3/4 cup water
4 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 teaspoon butter extract

Topping:
1/2 cup Sugar
2 Teaspoons Cinnamon
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients for 8 minutes at high speed.  

Grease 2 loaf pans.

Put 1/4 batter in each pan. Add some cinnamon and sugar mixture, then more batter.

Pull knife through the above to swirl.

Top with remaining topping mix.

Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes.

ingredientList:
3 eggs
2 cups sugar
1 cup oils
2 cups zucchini squash, coarsely shredded
3 teaspoons vanilla extract
3 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon baking powder
1 cup nuts optional
recipeText:
Grate the entire raw Zucchini to make 2 cups.

Beat eggs until fluffy.

Add sugar, oil, vanilla, and Squash. Mix well. 

Add dry ingredients.

Place into 2 greased bread pans.

Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes.


*Adeline: I like to use 3- 7 3/4 x 3 5/8 x 2 1/4  and bake about 40 to 45 Minutes.

ingredientList:
1 cup diced ham
2 cups tater tots still frozen
1 dozen eggs, whisked
1 can Pillsbury grand biscuits, diced and thawed
2 cups cheese, any kind, but best with cheddar
1/4 cup milk
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients together put in a greased bundt pan.

Bake at 400 degrees for 45 minutes. When done, flip onto platter, cut and serve.

You can use any veggies you want.  Do not add extra bread. 
The tater tots add just the right amount of potatoes; they shred up and you would think they were hash browns without making it dense.

ingredientList:
2 cups Original Bisquick® baking mix
1/2 cup cold water
2 tablespoons butter or margarine soft
1/4 cup packed brown sugar
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoon packed brown sugar
1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoon butter or margarine
36 pecans halves
recipeText:
Mix baking mix and water until dough forms. Gently smooth dough into balls on cloth-covered surface generously dusted with baking mix. Kneed 15 times.

Roll dough into rectangles, 15 x 9 inches. Spread rectangle with 2 tablespoons margarine or butter.

Mix 1/4 cup brown sugar and the cinnamon: sprinkle over rectangle. Roll up tightly, beginning at the 15 inch side. Pinch edge of dough into roll to seal well.

Wrap securely in Plastic wrap and refrigerate up to 24 hours if desired.


Heat (1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons) brown sugar and (1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons) margarine in a 1 quart saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly until sugar is dissolved and well mixed with margarine. 

Place 2 teaspoons brown sugar mixture in each of 12 medium muffin cups. 

Slice the dough into 2 1/2 x 1 1/4 inches slices. Place dough slice, cut side down, into the muffin cup.

Bake at 400 degrees until golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes.

Immediately invert on heatproof serving plate, let pan remain a few minutes.

ingredientList:
1 pound Jimmy Dean Hot Sausage, brown and drain
9 eggs, beaten
3 cups milk
4 slices bread, cubed
1 1/2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese
1 1/2 teaspoons dry mustard
1 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons dried minced onion
recipeText:
Put browned sausage in the bottom of a 9"x13" pan. Sprinkle with cheese and onion flakes. Cover with bread.
In a separate bowl, mix egg, milk, mustard, and salt. Pour mixture over the bread.

Bake at 350° for 40-45 minutes.

ingredientList:
8 cups shredded hash brown potatoes
1/2 cup melted butter
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1 1/2 cups Monterey Jack-Colby cheese shredded
1 1/2 cups Cheddar cheese shredded
2 cups cooked ham diced
8 eggs
1 1/2 evaporated milk or heavy cream Not sure how much cream
I had 1 1/2 whiten down so think cup
1 teaspoon seasoned salt
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
1/2 teaspoon Dry mustard
1/4 teaspoon onion powder
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.

Spray 9x13 pan or grease with butter.  Add shredded hash browns.

Melt butter pour over potatoes evenly. Sprinkle potatoes with salt, and pepper, then toss.

Bake for 25 to 30 minutes.  If using real potatoes, stir and cook until tender, about another 10 minutes.

Whisk eggs, cream, seasoning, dry mustard, and onion powder.  Add ham and cheese, and stir.

Can add peppers, tomatoes, or use breakfast sausage.

Pour over potatoes evenly.

Bake 40 minutes until edges start to brown and center does not jiggle when you shake the pan.

ingredientList:
2 eggs
2 cups milk
3 tablespoons sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 cups flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
4 tablespoons melted Crisco
recipeText: Mix well and bake in a greased frying pan.

ingredientList:
2 eggs
2 cups milk
2 cups all-purpose flour
3 tablespoons sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
4 tablespoons melted Crisco
recipeText: Mix well and bake in greased frying pan.

ingredientList:
2 eggs
3 tablespoons sugar
1 cup milk
1 1/2 tablespoons shortening
1 pinch salt
3 cups flour
1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
Apple slices
1/2 cup sugar and cinnamon mixture
recipeText:
Mix eggs, sugar, milk, shortening, and salt together.  When well mixed, add flour & baking powder.  Press into a greased, floured 9x13 inch cake pan.  

Place apple slices in rows, sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar.  

Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

ingredientList:
APPLE MIXTURE:
2 granny smith apples diced small and mix
3 tablespoons grandulated sugar
1 teaspoon cinnamon

CINNAMON TOPPING:
1 cup butter
1 cup brown sugar
2 tablespoons flour
1 tablespoon cinnamon

CAKE:
3 cups flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup sugar
4 teaspoons baking powder
1 1/2 cups milk
2 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1/2 butter melted

GLAZE:
2 cups powdered sugar
5 tablespoons milk
1 vanilla extract
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.

Grease a 9x13 pan. 

Make apple mixture: Dice the apples and mix with cinnamon and sugar, set aside.

Make cinnamon topping: Mix together the butter, sugar, flour, and cinnamon until smooth.  The consistency of this will be like paste. Set aside.

Make cake batter: Mix cake ingredients together until combined.  Gently mix in the apple mixture spread into prepared pan.

Drop the cinnamon topping by spoon over the cake; swirl the topping through cake with a knife.

Bake 35-45 minutes until toothpick inserted into the center comes out clear.

Mix together glaze ingredients until smooth.  Spread over warm cake. Let stand at least 20 minutes.

ingredientList:
Cake: 
2 cups Original Bisquick
2/3 cup milk or cold water
3 tablespoons sugar
1 egg
2 cups thinly sliced apples

Topping:
2/3 cup Original Bisquick
2/3 cup packed brown sugar
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
1/4 cup firm butter or margarine

Topping:
2 tablespoons chopped nuts
1/2 cup powdered sugar
2 - 3 teaspoons milk
recipeText:
Heat oven to 400 degrees.  Grease square 9" x 9" x 2" pan.  Mix 2 cups Bisquick, 2/3 cup milk, 3 tablespoons of sugar, and egg; beat vigorously for 30 seconds.  Spread half of the batter in pan.  

Streusel Topping: Mix 2/3 cup Bisquick, brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg.  Cut in margarine until crumbly.

Arrange apple slices on batter; sprinkle with half of the Streusel Topping.  Spread remaining batter over apple slices; sprinkle with remaining topping.  Sprinkle with nuts.  Bake until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean, about 25 minutes.  Cool.  

Glaze:  Mix powdered sugar and 2 - 3 teaspoons milk. Drizzle over cake.

High altitude: Heat oven to 425 degrees.  Bake about 30 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 1/2 cups sifted flour
1 2/3 cups sugar
1 1/4 teaspoons baking powder
1 1/4 teaspoons baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
2/3 cup shortening
1/3 cup buttermilk
1 1/4 mashed bananas
3 eggs
1/3 cup buttermilk
2/3 cup nuts
recipeText:
Sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.

Add shortening, 1/3 cup buttermilk, and mashed bananas.  Beat two minutes.
Add eggs and 1/3 cup buttermilk. Mix. Add nuts.

Bake 45-50 minutes at 350 degrees.

* total of 2 cups of buttermilk  ????

ingredientList:
CAKE:
2 cups sugar
2 teaspoons baking soda
2 cups flour
2 teaspoons cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 1/2 cups oil
4 eggs
3 cups shredded carrots
3/4 cup nut and raisins

FROSTING:
4 ounces Philadelphia cream cheese
2 1/4 cups powdered sugar
2 teaspoons soft butter
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
pinch of salt
recipeText:
Sift together dry cake ingredients.  Add oil and eggs, beat until mixed.  Add carrots and raisins and mix.

Pour into a 9 x 13 pan.  

Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 Minutes.  Cool.

Mix frosting ingredients and frost the cake.

Refrigerate the cake after frosting.

recipeName: Cherry Angel Cream Cake - Kathleen (Wellmann) Guse
ingredientList:
1 10 to 12-oz prepared angel food cake, frozen if desired.
1 can 14-oz eagle brand condensed milk
1 cup cold water
1 teaspoon almond extract
1 package 4 serving size instant vanilla pudding
1 pint whipped cream whipped
2 21-oz cherry pie filling or any flavor
recipeText:
Cut cake into 1/4 inch slices Arrange 1/2 the slices on the bottom of a 13 x 9 inch baking dish.

In large mixer combine sweetened condensed milk, water, and extract. Mix well. Add pudding mix. Beat well for about 5 minutes, fold in whipped cream. 

Spread 1/2 the cream mixture over cake slices.

Top evenly with one can cherry filling. Top with remaining cake slices, then remaining cream mixture, and remaining cherry filling. 

Chill 4 hours or until set. Cut into squares and serve. Refrigerate leftovers.

ingredientList:
1 cup dates cut fine
1 cup hot water
13/4 cups flour
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup choc chips
1 cup butter part shortening
1 cup white sugar
1 teaspoon baking soda
2 eggs
1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa
1/2 cup nuts
recipeText:
Add soda to dates, pour hot water over them.  

Cream shortening and sugar, combine with dates, flour, eggs, cocoa, and vanilla. Add 1/2 cup chocolate chips. 

Sprinkle rest of chips on the top with nuts.

Bake 40 minutes in a moderate oven 350 degrees.

recipeName: Chocolate Chip Date Cake - Mary Kuntz (Bob's)
ingredientList:
1 cup chopped dates
1 1/2 cups boiling water
1 3/4 teaspoons baking soda
1/2 cup shortening
1 cup sugar
2 eggs, beaten
1 1/2 cups flour
1/4 teaspoon salt

Topping:
1 package semisweet chocolate chips
1/2 cup nuts
1/2 cup sugar
recipeText:
Pour boiling water over the dates and let cool.

Cream shortening and sugar.  Add dates and remaining ingredients except topping ingredients.   Pour into a greased cake pan.  Top with chocolate chips, nuts, and 1/2 cup sugar.

Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 cup rolled oats
1 1/4 cups boiling water
1/2 cup butter, softened
1 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg

FROSTING:
6 tablespoons butter, softened
2/3 cup packed brown sugar
1/4 cup half and half
2/3 cup chopped pecans or walnuts
1 cup flaked coconut
recipeText:
Mix the cake ingredients.  Pour into a greased, floured cake pan.  Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.  

Mix the frosting ingredients.  Spread on cake.

ingredientList:
1 white (vanilla) cake mix
6 tablespoons creme de menthe extract
1 16-ounce jar chocolate fudge topping
4 tablespoons creme de menthe extract
1 12-ounce container cool whip
recipeText:
Mix the cake mix as directed.  Add 6 tablespoons of creme de menthe.  Bake in a 9" x 13" cake pan at 350 degrees.  Let cool.

Spread jar of chocolate fudge topping over the cake.

Mix 4 tablespoons of creme de menthe into the cool whip container.  Spread over chocolate fudge.  Refrigerate. 

Can be made the day before.

ingredientList:
1 box yellow (lemon) cake mix
1 package instant lemon pudding mixes
4 eggs
2/3 cup corn oil
3/4 cup water
recipeText: Add all ingredients and beat.  Don't grease the pan.  Use two 4" x 8" bread pans.  Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.  Cool completely before removing from the pan.

recipeDescription: This is like Mock Angel Food Cake.
ingredientList:
2 cups cake flour
2 cups sugar
1 cup broiling water

pinch of salt
2 teaspoons baking powder
5 egg whites 
vanilla
1/2 tsp cream of Tarter

FROSTING:
5 egg yokes
1 small can carnation milk
1 cup sugar
recipeText:
Sift cake flour and sugar 4 times.  Add one cup boiling water.  Mix together well and cover with a plate.  Let stand overnight on the counter.

The next morning: add salt and baking soda.  Mix well.  

Beat egg whites with vanilla until stiff.  Add Cream of Tarter and fold into the rest of the mixture.  Don't whip; turn ingredients together with a spatula.

Cook in Double Boiler.  Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes.  Bake on lowest shelf.

Make the frosting and spread on cake.  Can sprinkle with nuts.

ingredientList:
2 tablespoons butter or margarine
1/3 cup packed brown sugar
1 tablespoon water
1 8-ounce can pineapple slices, drained and halved
4 maraschino cherries, halved
1 1/3 cups flour
2/3 cup sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
2/3 cup milk
1/4 cup butter or margarine
1 egg
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
In a saucepan, melt 2 tablespoons butter, add brown sugar and water, stir until dissolved.  Remove from heat.  Pour mixture into bottom of cake pan.  

Place pineapple slices on top of sugar mixture.  Fill center of each pineapple with a cherry.  

In a mixing bowl, combine the remaining ingredients.  Beat 2 minutes.  Pour batter over pineapple, being careful not to disturb the fruit.  

Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.  Let stand 5 minutes.  Loosen edges and invert cake onto a platter.

ingredientList:
2 cups cake flour
2 cups sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
1 cup boiling water
5 egg whites
2 teaspoons cream of tartar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract or almond Extract
1/2 teaspoon salt

Filling:
2 cups raspberries
1 cup sugar
1 cup water
1/4 cup cornstarch
recipeText:
Sift flour, sugar, and baking powder. Add boiling water.  Mix together and let stand overnight. 

Beat egg whites, cream of tartar, and salt until it stands in points. Then fold in rest. Put into 9x13 inch ungreased pan. 

Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Tip over like angel food cake to cool.

Cook berries until soft in saucepan. Strain off the juice to get rid of seeds. Add Water to juice. Mix a little water in cornstarch. Add slowly to liquid to thicken. Cool completely. 

Split the cake into 2 layers. Return 1 Layer to clean pan, spread 1/2 the filling over it, put on the second layer. Add remaining filling and top with whipped cream. 

Refrigerator overnight.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups brown sugar
1/2 cup shortening
1 cup buttermilk
1 teaspoon baking soda
2 cups flour
1 egg
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 1/2 cups rhubarb
dash of salt
make buttermilk by using milk and vinegar
Topping
1/2 cup sugar
1 teaspoon cinnamon
recipeText: Mix all together and spread in a 9 X 13 greased and floured pan. Put on cake and bake for 30 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups sugar
1/2 cup shortening
1 teaspoon salt
4 teaspoons baking powder
2 eggs
1 cup milk
2 cups flour
3 to 4 cups chopped rhubarb
recipeText:
Place chopped rhubarb in the bottom of a pan.  Sprinkle with 1 cup sugar.

Pour batter over top.

Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour.

Gets dark on top but keep testing to make sure batter is cooked through.

ingredientList:
CAKE:
1 Yellow cake mix
4 eggs
1/2 cup oils
11 ounces Mandarin oranges Do not drain


TOPPING:
1 - 3-ounce box instant vanilla pudding
16 ounces crushed pineapple do not drain
8 ounces cool whip
recipeText:
Mix cake ingredients. 
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.  Let cool.

Mix pudding mix and pineapple and let thicken for 5 minutes.  Fold in cool whip. 

Top cake with pudding topping.

ingredientList:
2/3 mashed potato
12-14 ounces flaked coconut
1 pound powdered sugar
1/2-1 teaspoon almond extract
1 large bag chocolate chips
1/4 block of paraffin wax
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients except chocolate chips.

Knead until all mixed well. Form balls. 

Melt chocolate chips and paraffin wax.  Dip balls in melted chocolate.

Set on wax paper to harden.

ingredientList:
1 24-ounce package almond bark
8 ounces semisweet chocolate chips
1 cup peanut butter
24 ounces peanuts, without skins
recipeText: Melt almond bark and chocolate chips at a low temperature.  Stir in peanut butter and peanuts.  Drop on wax paper.

ingredientList:
1 cup pecans halves
2 cups sugar
4 teaspoons cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup water
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients except pecans, and cook until soft ball firm. 2-3 minutes after boiling Remove from heat.

Meanwhile, place the pecans on a cookie sheet in 375 degree oven for about 3 minutes. 

Mix the nuts into the candy mixture and stir until coated and it turns to sugar.

Cool on wax paper. Break apart with your fingers.

ingredientList:
1/2 Vanilla
1 tablespoon cold water
1 egg white
1 pound pecans
1 cup granulated sugar
1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon
1 teaspoon salt
recipeText:
Set oven to 230 degrees. 

Place pecans in a large bowl.

Beat egg whites, water, and vanilla until very frothy. Add the pecans to the egg whites and stir to coat all the pecans evenly. 

In a small bowl, mix the sugar, salt and cinnamon together.

Then, pour the sugar over the pecans and mix again. Make sure all the pecans are covered with the sugar mixture.

Place on 13x18 inch cookie sheet.

Bake for 1 hour, flipping pecans over after the first 30 minutes.  (Some recipes suggest flipping every 15 minutes.)

Store in an air-tight container.

ingredientList:
1 pound brown sugar
1 pound white sugar 2 cups
1 jar karo light corn syrup (pint)
1 can borders sweetened condensed milk
2 tablespoons butter
recipeText: Boil in heavy pan almost to 250 degrees.  Can wrap in wax paper.

ingredientList:
1 cup chopped dates
3 tablespoons melted butter
1 cup chopped nuts
1 cup peanut butter

2 squares unsweetened baking chocolate
1 package 6-oz semi-sweet chocolate chips
1 square paraffin wax
recipeText:
Mix dates, butter, nuts, and peanut butter. With hands, form into small balls.

Melt unsweetened baking chocolate, semi-sweet chocolate chips, and paraffin wax.

Dip balls into chocolate and set on wax paper to harden.

ingredientList:
30 marshmallows
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/2 cup butter
Green food coloring
3 1/2 cups corn flakes
2 teaspoons red food coloring
recipeText:
Combine marshmallows, vanilla, and butter.  Beat until melted.  Put in corn flakes.  

Drop on wax paper and shape into wreaths.  

Put red dots on with food coloring.

ingredientList:
1 1/4 cups sugar
1/4 cup corn syrup
1/4 cup cold water
1 egg white
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/4 cup nuts
recipeText:
Cook sugar, corn syrup and water in 2-quart saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly, until sugar is dissolved. Cook, about 20 minutes, without stirring, to 260 degrees on candy thermometer or until small amount of mixture dropped into cup of very cold water forms a hard ball that holds its shape but is pliable.

Beat egg whites with electric mixer on high speed until stiff peaks form.  Continue beating constantly on medium speed while pouring hot syrup in a thin stream into egg whites. Add vanilla and food coloring if desired. Beat until mixture holds its shape and becomes slightly dull, scraping bowl occasionally.  Stir in nuts.

Quickly drop heaping teaspoonfuls of mixture from buttered spoon onto waxed paper. Let stand uncovered at room temperature at least 4 hours, but no longer than 12 hours until candies feel firm and are dry to the touch. Store in airtight container.

ingredientList:
1 12-ounce package (2 cups) semisweet chocolate chips
1 14-ounce can sweetened condensed milk
1 1/4 cups chopped walnuts
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Using a double boiler, combine chocolate chips and condensed milk.  Stir until the chocolate melts and mixture is smooth.  Stir in walnuts and vanilla.  

Spread evenly into foil-lined 9" round pan or 8" square pan.  Chill until firm, about 2 hours.  Cut wreath into 2" wedges or cut square into 1" squares.  Alternately, roll squares into balls and roll in finely chopped walnuts.

Makes about 64 squares.

recipeDescription: Makes 10 small lollipops or 30 mini candies.
ingredientList:
1 cup sugar
1/3 cup hot water
1/3 cup light corn syrup
1/2 teaspoon food coloring
1/2 teaspoon flavoring
Wilton super flex candy molds
recipeText:
Spray molds lightly with cooking spray.  Combine sugar, hot water, and corn syrup in a pan.  Place on high heat and stir until all sugar crystals are dissolved.  

Clip candy thermometer on the side of the pan and continue cooking without stirring.  When thermometer registers 300 degrees, remove pan from heat.  

Let mixture stand for 2 minutes until bubbles disappear.  Add flavoring and food coloring, stir to blend.  

Pour mixture into prepared molds and let harden at room temperature for 10 minutes.  Unmold.  Keeps for about 6 weeks.

ingredientList:
1 can large evaporated milk
4 1/2 cups sugar
1/2 cup butter



3 packages semi-sweet chocolate chips
2 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 pint marshmallow creme
2 cups nuts
recipeText:
Mix evaporated milk, sugar, and butter in a pan.  Stir until completely dissolved, bring to boil and boil exactly 10 minutes.

In a bowl, mix chocolate chips, vanilla extract, marshmallow creme, and nuts.  

Pour over first mixture and mix well. Pour into buttered Pan. Let harden overnight. 

Makes 5 lb.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup margarine
2 cups powdered sugar
14 ounces flaked coconut
1/4 cup sweetened condensed milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1 square bitter chocolate
3/4 of a bar of paraffin wax
recipeText:
Mix margarine, powdered sugar, coconut, sweetened condensed milk, and vanilla.  Make small balls and chill in the refrigerator.

Melt the chocolate and wax in a double boiler.  

Use a toothpick, spear the coconut balls and dip into the hot chocolate mixture.  Lay on wax paper to cool.  

Drop a little chocolate into the toothpick hole to hide it.

ingredientList:
2 cups sugar
1 small can sweetened condensed milk
10 marshmallows
1 package choc chips
2 tablespoons melted butter
1/2 cup ground nuts (optional)
recipeText:
Bring sugar, milk, and marshmallows to a rolling boil.  Then boil for 3 minutes.

Put chocolate chips and melted butter in a bowl.  

Add hot ingredients to bowl and stir. Add nuts.  Pour into buttered pan and cool.

ingredientList:
1 jar 7 oz marshmallow creme
2/3 cup fat free evaporated milk
1/2 cup butter cubed
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
3 cups (18oz) semisweet chocolate chips
2 cups chopped pecans or walnuts toasted
recipeText:
Line a 9-in. square pan with foil and coat foil with nonstick cooking spray, set aside.

In a large saucepan, combine the marshmallow creme, evaporated milk, and butter. Cook and stir over medium heat until smooth.
Bring to a boil, boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. 
Remove from the heat and add vanilla. 

Stir in chocolate chips until melted. Add pecans. Pour into prepared pan. 

Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm.

Remove fudge from pan and carefully remove foil.  Cut into 1 inch squares. Store in the refrigerator.

Yields 2-2/3 pounds.

ingredientList:
36 caramels
1 cup Rice Krispies®
1 cup corn flakes
1 cup coconut
1 cup chopped pecans
3 tablespoons milk
recipeText:
Melt caramels in milk. Mix together: Rice Krispies, Corn Flakes, Coconut and pecans. 
Pour melted caramels over mixture and roll into balls.

ingredientList:
2 quarts popped corn
2 cups almonds
1 1/2 cups pecans
1 1 /2 cups cashews
1 1/3 cups sugar
1 cup butter
1/2 cup white light corn syrup
1/2 tsp vanilla
recipeText:
Mix popcorn, almonds, pecans, cashews and set aside. 

Combine sugar, butter and white syrup in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Boil 15 minutes or until mixture turns a light caramel color.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. 

Pour over popcorn mixture and stir. When cool, break into pieces.  If sticky, put in low heat (200 degrees) oven for a few minutes.

ingredientList:
2 egg whites (3) small
3/4 cup sugar
3/4 cup coconut
2 cups cornflakes
recipeText:
Beat egg whites until stiff, stir in sugar. Then stir in coconut and cornflakes. 

Drop from tablespoon onto greased cookie sheets. 

Bake in slow oven (300-325 degrees) until just slightly browned on bottom. 

Cool on sheet before removing.

ingredientList:
2 cups sugar
1 cup light corn syrup
1 1/2 teaspoons salt
2 tablespoons butter
1/4 teaspoon peppermint extract
7 drops green food coloring
1 1/2 cups water
recipeText:
Combine sugar, syrup, salt, & water in a 2-quart sauce pan.  Cook slowly until sugar dissolves.  Then cook to hard ball stage (260 degrees) without stirring.  Remove from heat.  

Stir in remaining ingredients.  Pour into buttered 15 1/2" x 10 1/2" x 1" pan.  Cool until comfortable to handle.  

Butter hands, gather taffy into a ball and pull.  When candy is light in color and hard to pull, cut into fourths.  Pull each piece into long strands about 1/2" thick.  

With buttered scissors, snip into bite size pieces.  Wrap each piece in wax paper.

ingredientList:
1 7-ounce jar marshmallow creme
2 1/4 cups powdered sugar
3 tablespoons water
17 ounces caramels
16 ounces salted peanuts
recipeText:
Knead together the marshmallow creme and powdered sugar.  Shape into small finger-like logs.  Place on waxed paper-lined cookie sheet and freeze.  

Melt caramels with water over a double boiler (or microwave).  Dip creme fingers into caramel mixture, then roll in chopped peanuts.  

Freeze until set.  Store in refrigerator.

ingredientList:
1 package dry  yeast
2 tablespoons warm water
1 cup margarine
3 cups flour
3 egg yolks
6 tablespoons milk
1 tablespoon sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 pound ground walnuts
1 cup sugar
Milk
Dash cinnamon
recipeText:
Sprinkle yeast on 2 tablespoons warm water and let stand for 5 minutes, mix.  Cut margarine into flour and mix well.  Add yeast mixture, yolks, milk, sugar, and vanilla.  Make into 9 balls and chill overnight.  

Mix walnuts, sugar, milk, and cinnamon.

Roll out dough (1 ball at a time) in powdered sugar into either a circle or rectangle.  Then cut pieces into squares or triangles.  Put a dab of nut filling in the center of each piece and roll piece.  Put on lightly greased cookie sheet.  Bake about 15 minutes at 350 degrees.  Dip in powdered sugar and let cool.  Nut rolls can be frozen.  If desired, sprinkle with a touch of powdered sugar just before serving.

ingredientList:
2 1/4 sugar
1/2 cup sour cream
1/4 cup milk
2 tablespoons butter
1 tablespoon light corn syrup
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 cup chopped nuts
1/3 cup candied cherries
recipeText:
Add ingredients from sugar to salt.  Cook in saucepan over moderate heat until sugar is dissolved.  Mixture needs to reach 238 degrees and takes 9 to 10 minutes. 

Remove from heat and allow to stand at room temperature until about 110 degrees (about 1 hour).

Add vanilla and beat until mixture just begins to lose its gloss and hold shape.  Requires very little beating. 

Quickly stir in walnuts and cherries and turn into a oiled pan. Let stand until firm before cutting.

Makes 1 1/2 pounds.

ingredientList:
3 cups vinegar
1 cup water
4 cups sugar
1/4 cup salt
1 1/2 teaspoons turmeric
1 1/8 teaspoons mustard seeds
pickles, sliced
onions, sliced
recipeText:
Mix everything together.  

Put in a jar and shake back and forth several times during the day.
 
Keep in the refrigerator.

ingredientList:
2 gallons large cucumbers rings; about 15 cucumbers.
2 cups dehydrated limes
8 1/2 quarts water
1 cup white vinegar
1 tablespoon alum
1 small bottle red food coloring

Syrup:
1 package red hot candies
2 cups vinegar
2 cups water
10 cups sugar
8 cinnamon sticks
recipeText:
Put cucumber rings and lime in water and let stand for 24 hours.

Drain rings and wash in cool water.

Cover with cold water and let stand 3 hours.

Drain and add vinegar, alum, and food coloring.  

Cover with water, heat and simmer for 2 hours.

Drain well and discard liquid.

Mix syrup ingredients and bring to a boil.  Pour over rings. Keep lid on tight and let stand overnight.

Drain and reheat the syrup for 3 mornings.  On the 4th morning, heat rings and syrup to a boil. 

Pack in sanitized jars and seal.

Makes 4-5 quarts.

ingredientList:
1 can 8 oz tomato sauce
1 can 6 oz tomato paste
2 Teaspoon dried oregano or basil leaves
1 clove garlic
recipeText:
Combine all ingredients and heat. 

Makes 1 1/2 cups.

recipeDescription: Use whatever vegetables you have in your fridge to make these tangy Pickles--- no canning necessary!
ingredientList:
6 cups sugar
6 cups white vinegar
1/4 cup celery seeds
1/4 cup mustard seeds
2 tablespoons canning salt or kosher salt
10 medium carrots, halved lengthwise and cut into 2-inch pieces
3 cucumbers slices
3 red bell peppers, cut into 1 inch pieces
2 onions, halved and sliced
1 bunch green onions, cut into 2 inch pieces
recipeText:
In a Dutch Oven, combine, sugar, white vinegar, celery seeds, mustard seeds, and salt.  Heat.

In a large bowl combine carrots, cucumbers, red bell peppers, onions, and green onions.

Pour hot liquid over vegetables.  Cool. Transfer to jars if desired, cover tightly. 

Refrigerate for 8 hours before serving. Store in the fridge for up to one month.
 
Makes 7 Pints

*I cut my carrots with a serrated cutter into 4 pieces. 
*Used big sweet onions and not much of the green onions (The ones I bout were not that great.) 
*I don't know why you couldn't just use Esther's recipe with the celery seed.

recipeName: Refrigerator Pickles - Bev Wellmann - They were Easter Johnsons Pickles
ingredientList:
6 cups cucumbers, sliced thin
1 cup or more onions, sliced thin
1 cup green peppers, diced
2 cups sugar
1 cup vinegar
2 tablespoons salt
1 teaspoon celery seeds
recipeText: Mix together and pour over cucumbers, onions, and green peppers. Put in covered container and keep in refrigerator.

ingredientList:
8 cups well drained tomatoes
2 1/2 cups onions
2 cups green, red, or any sweet peppers
1/2 cup hot jalapeño peppers
6 cloves garlic
2 teaspoons cumin
2 teaspoons pepper
2 tablespoons canning or pickling salt
1/3 cup sugar
1/3 cup vinegar
1 (16-ounce) can tomato sauce
1 (12-ounce) can tomato paste
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients together. 

Boil for 10 - 15 minutes, until mixture thickens as desired.

recipeName: Sliced Red Apple Rings  - Grandma Alice Lendt
ingredientList:
4 - 6 apples
1 1/2 cups water
2 cups sugar
1/2 cup vinegar
6 whole cloves
1 - 2 sticks cinnamon
red food coloring
recipeText:
Wash, peel, and core apples. Slice them 1/2 inch thick.

Make a syrup of the sugar, water, and vinegar. Tied cloves and cinnamon in a bag. Cook the apples and spices in the syrup, turning often until the fruit is clear.

Remove the apples and spice bag from the mixture.

Add red food coloring to the syrup. Pour the syrup over the apples. Cool. Makes 12 - 16 rings.

ingredientList:
25 pounds toamtoes
5 onions about 7-8 cups chopped
4 red bell peppers
1 green bell pepper
4 6 oz cans tomato paste
1/4 cup soy sauce it's weird but trust us it deepens the tomato flavor like you won't believe
3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
2/3 cup brown sugar
1/4 cup salt
10 garlic cloves chopped or minced
3 tablespoons oregano dried
3 tablespoons basil dried
2 teaspoons red pepper flakes
2 bay leaves
1 1/4 cups lemon juice for jars
recipeText:
Boil tomatoes for 2 to 3 minutes. Take out and put into cold water. Take out of cold water and peel off skins. Quarter in food processor cover and process green peppers, onions in batches until finely chopped.  

In a large stock pot combine tomatoes do not discard excess juices from tomatoes, onion/ pepper mixture, tomato paste, soy sauce, worchestershire sauce, brown sugar, salt, garlic, oregano, basil, pepper flakes and bay leaves, bring to a boil and simmer 4 to 5 hours, stirring every 15 minutes or so (tomatoes burn easily so keep an eye on it).

Discard bay leaves If you want it smooth and thick you can put in a blender and blend tomatoes until smooth with no large chunk.

Add 2 Tablespoons lemon juice to 9 or 10 jars hot Quart jars ladle hot mixture into jars, leaving 1/2 in headspace at the top. Remove air bubbles, wipe rims, and adjust lids.

For water bath process for 40 minutes in a boiling water canner for altitudes 1,000 feet or less. For altitudes up to 3,000 feet, add 5 minutes, 6,000 feet, add 10 minutes 8,000 add 15 minutes, 10,000 add 20 minutes.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup salad oil
4 meds garlic minced
4 onions diced
2 tablespoons parsley Flakes
2 tablespoons salt
2-3 teaspoons pepper
1 teaspoon fennel seed
2 (12-ounce) cans tomato paste
1/4 cup sugar
2 tablespoons oregano
2 teaspoons basil
2 bay leaves
16 tomatoes peeled and diced
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients in a pot. (Can put in crock pot and let it cook for several hours.)

Simmer 2 hours covered.

Throw out bay leaves.

I line to sauce at this point.

Makes 4 quarts.  You can freeze this.

ingredientList:
6 1/2 cups cold water
1/2 cup picking salt
3 1/4 cups white vinegar
1 teaspoon alum
3 cloves garlic
Cucumbers dill fresh
recipeText:
Put washed cucumbers in a clean gallon jar with dill on the bottom and top. 
Mix other ingredients together and pour over cucumbers. 
Put lid on jar and set out in sun for 3 days; leave longer if sun is not bright.

Keep the pickles refrigerated. 

Marlene said she adds onions.

recipeDescription: From Marlene. Can use for Hot dish.
ingredientList:
20 pounds tomatoes
1 bunch celery chopped
5 onions chopped
1/2 cup flour
1/2 cup butter or margarine
1/4 cup sugar
1/4 cup salt
Min and add to above boil for 10 minutes
seal hot and tip jar over for 10 minutes or so
recipeText:
Boil tomatoes, celery, and onions for 3 hours. 
Mix flour, butter or margarine, sugar, and salt.  Add to the tomato mixture and boil for 10 minutes.

Seal hot and tip jar over for at least 10 minutes.

*Marlene often adds 2 peppers, 2/3 cup vinegar, 1 teaspoon celery seed, and a little mustard and garlic.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup margarine
1/4 cup sugar
1/4 cup brown sugar
1 cup flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1 egg
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 cup nuts
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients.  Bake at 375 degrees for 8 - 10 minutes. 

Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
1 cup margarine
3/4 cup brown sugar
3/4 cup sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 eggs
1 tablespoon hot water
1 package semi-sweet chocolate chips
2 cups rolled oats
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients, except chocolate chips and oats, together.  When mixture forms a dough, add chocolate chips and oats.

Drop on greased cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 packages semi-sweet chocolate chips
5 cups corn flakes
1 cup dates cut small
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 squares chocolate bitter
1 cup chopped nuts
recipeText:
Melt chocolate in double boiler (or microwave).  Mix other ingredients.  Pour chocolate over mixture and blend well.

Form into balls and roll in powdered sugar.

ingredientList:
1 cup margarine
1 cup sugar
3 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
4 cups flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
Dates, ground
Sugar
Nuts
Leftover jams
recipeText:
Mix margarine, 1 cup sugar, eggs, vanilla, flour, baking powder, and salt.  

In a separate bowl, combine dates, some sugar, nuts, and any unused jams.  Can also add raisins, coconut, cookie crumbs, and maybe a little water. 

Roll out dough and cut in rounds, fill and with date mixture.

Bake.

ingredientList:
1 cup sugar
1 cup water
1/2 cup butter
1 cup raisins
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon celery
1/4 teaspoon cloves
2 cups flour
1 cup dates, chopped
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 eggs, beaten
1 cup walnuts, chopped
recipeText:
Combine and boil the above ingredients from sugar to the cloves for six minutes.

Then add flour, dates, vanilla, eggs, and walnuts.

Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet.

Bake for 10 minutes at 375 degrees.

ingredientList:
1 cup brown sugar
1 cup sugar
1 cup butter
2 eggs, beaten
2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon baking powder
2 cups oats
2 cups corn flakes
1 cup coconut
1 cup nuts
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Cream sugar, butter, and eggs.  Sift flour, salt, soda, and baking powder.  Add to creamed ingredients.  Add oatmeal, cornflakes, coconut, nuts, and vanilla.  

Roll into balls and press down on greased cookie sheet.  Bake 10 - 12 minutes at 350 degrees.

Makes 4 dozen cookies.  To vary recipe, add green and red maraschino cherries, cut into pieces, then bake.

ingredientList:
2 cups shortening
3 cups sugar
4 eggs
1/4 cup milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
5 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
recipeText:
Cream shortening, sugar, and eggs.  Stir in milk and vanilla.  Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together and stir into mixture until well blended.

Shape into a 1 1/2 inch thick roll.  Roll in waxed paper or wet cloth.  Chill several hours.  Slice thin.  

Bake at 35 degrees until light golden brown about 10 minutes.  

Makes 5 dozen cookies.

ingredientList:
1 cup white sugar
1/2 cup shortening
2/3 cup baking molasses
2 eggs
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon ginger
2 3/4 cups flour
recipeText:
Either drop from a spoon or form into balls. Dip them in sugar and flatten some.

Bake at 350 degrees.

ingredientList:
1 cup brown sugar
3 eggs
1 cup sugar
1 1/2 cups peanut butter
4 1/2 cups oatmeal
3/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 tablespoon corn syrup
1/2 cup butter
2 teaspoons baking soda
1/4 pound semisweet chocolate chips
1/4 pound M&M's
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients, except chocolate, in a large bowl.  Stir in chocolate.  You may also add raisins.  Drop onto greased cookie sheets.  

Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 cups sugar
1/2 cup shortening
1/2 cup milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 pinch salt
3 cups quick cook oats
1 cup coconut
5 tablespoons baking cocoa
1/2 cup nuts
recipeText:
Mix sugar, shortening, milk, vanilla, and salt in a pan and heat until boiling.  Pour over oats, coconut, cocoa, and nuts.  Mix well. 

Drop on waxed paper and let sit until cool.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup milk
2 cups sugar
6 tablespoons coconut
1/4 cup butter
1/2 cup peanut butter
3 cups oatmeal
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Boil milk, sugar, coconut, and butter for 1 minute.

Add peanut butter, oatmeal, and vanilla extract.

Mix all together and drop on wax paper.

ingredientList:
2 teaspoons grated orange rinds
2 cups raw oatmeal
1/2 cup salad oil
3/4 cup sugar
2 teaspoons salt
1 egg beaten
1/2 cup chopped nuts
recipeText:
Hand mix orange rinds, oatmeal, oil, sugar, and salt.  Chill overnight.

The next morning, add egg and nuts to mixture.

Bake 15 minutes.

Makes 30 cookies.

ingredientList:
1 cup softened butter
1 cup brown sugar
1/3 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
2 1/2 cups quick oatmeal
3/4 cup raisins
10 ounces package cinnamon chips
recipeText:
Beat butter and sugars until creamy. Add Eggs and vanilla. Beat well. 

Combine flour and baking soda. Add to the butter mixture. Stir in the oatmeal, raisins, and cinnamon chips. Batter will be stiff. 

Drop by heaping teaspoonful onto ungreased sheet.

Bake 10 to 12 minutes at 350 degrees or until lightly brown.

Yields 48 cookies.

ingredientList:
2/3 cup flour
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
1/2 cup packed brown sugar
1 egg
1 tablespoon dark rum or  orange juice
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 1/2 cups oats
3/4 cup mixed dried fruit
2/3 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1/2 cup sweetened flaked coconut
1/3 cup roasted salted peanuts
recipeText:
Heat the oven to 375 degrees.  Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.  

Beat butter and brown sugar in a large bowl at medium-high speed 3 - 4 minutes, or until light and fluffy.  Beat in egg, rum, and vanilla until smooth.  

At low speed, beat in flour, baking soda, and salt.  Stir in remaining ingredients.  (Dough will be very stiff.)

Drop dough by 1 1/2 tablespoons on baking sheets at least 3 inches apart.  Bake 8 to 11 minutes or until golden brown and set.  Cool completely on wire rack.  Best if eaten within 3 days.

ingredientList:
Cookies:
2 cups brown sugar
1 cup crisco
1 cup oleo
1 1/2 cups sour milk (can use 2 tsp. vinegar)
2 teaspoons baking soda
6 cups minute oatmeal
2 cups flour
salt
vanilla extract

Filling:
1 cup cold water
1 package dates
3/4 cup sugar
recipeText:
Boil filling until pasty. Let filling cool.

Mix cookie ingredients. Roll thin, then cut with a cookie cutter. 

Put two cookies together with date mixture in the center (use very little date mix). 

Bake 10 minutes at 350°.

recipeName: Overnight Icebox Cookies  - Marlene and Ex
ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups margarine
1 cup brown sugar
1 cup sugar
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon cinnamon
2 eggs
4 1/2 cups flour
Vanilla extract
1 cup nuts
recipeText:
Cream margarine and sugars.  Add eggs and beat well until "fluffy".  Add dry ingredients, vanilla and nuts.  Make about 4 rolls and chill overnight.  

Slice thin.  Bake at 350 degrees.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup shortening or margarine
1/2 cup peanut butter
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 cup brown sugar
1 unbeaten egg
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 3/4 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
little salt
Hershey's Kisses
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients except Hershey's Kisses.

Shape in small ball. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes.

Take out and add Hershey's Kiss in center of cookie.

Bake for 5 more minutes.

Makes 3 to 3 1/2 Dozen.

ingredientList:
1 cup sugar
1 egg
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup margarine
3 cups flour
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients together.  Roll out dough and cut with cookie cutters.

Bake at 350 degrees for 8 - 10 minutes.

recipeName: The Official Authentic  Mrs. Fields Cookie Recipe
ingredientList:
1 pound butter
1 1/2 cups sugar
2 cups dark brown sugar
3 eggs
6 cups flour
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 1/2 teaspoons salt
1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda

4 to 5 cups chocolate chips
2 cups chopped nuts
OR
2 cups raisins
1 1-2 cups oatmeal
recipeText:
Cream together butter, and both sugars.  Add eggs, flour, vanilla, salt, and baking soda.  Beat 3 to 4 minutes.  Batter may be dry.

Add chocolate chips and nuts OR raisins and oatmeal.


Cover cookie sheet with waxed-paper. Scoop dough out with an ice cream scoop. Place 2 inches apart.  Change waxed paper for every new batch of cookies.

Bake at 350 degrees for 8-11 minutes.  Cookies may not be completely done.

Makes 4 to 5 dozen cookies.

*Do not half this recipe or it will not turn out.  This is Mrs. Fields recipe. It is authentic and was obtained from Mrs. Fields before they copyrighted and classified it.

recipeName: Chicken and Noodles Crock Pot - Erin (Kern) Eustice
ingredientList:
2 cans cream of chicken soup
2 cans chicken broth 15 oz
1 stick butter or margarine
1 pound chicken breasts fresh or frozen
1 package egg noodles 24 oz (I use Reamer)
recipeText:
In a crockpot, put chicken on bottom. Pour the chicken broth and soup on top, Top that with the stick of butter.  Cook on low for 6 to 7 hours.
Take the chicken out and shred. Put back in crockpot, add the frozen noodles and cook for 2 more hours. I stir every 30 minutes until done.

ingredientList:
3 Medium potatoes, thinly sliced
2 large carrots, thinly sliced
1 onion sliced
dry onion soup mix IF Desired
2-3 pounds beef chuck pot roast
1/2 cup water
salt and pepper
recipeText:
Put vegetables in bottom of crock-pot. Salt and pepper meat and put in pot. Cover with water.

Cover and cook: 
Low: 10-12 hours
High: 5-6 Hours

ingredientList:
3 medium potatoes, thinly sliced
2 large carrots, thinly sliced
1 onion, sliced
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
4 pounds beef rump roast
1/2 cup water
2 packages onion soup mix, dry
recipeText:
Put vegetables in the bottom of the crock-pot.  Salt and pepper meat, then put in pot.  Sprinkle on onion soup mix.  Add liquid.  

Cover, cook on low 10 - 12 hours (high 5-6 hours).

ingredientList:
1 package pork chops
can cream of chicken soup
package dry ranch salad dressing mix
recipeText:
Layer pork chops in crock pot. Pour cream of chicken soup over pork. Sprinkle dry ranch dressing on top.

Cover and cook: 
Low: 6 hours
High: 4 hours

Pork chops will be very tender and amazing flavor. Will also get very good gravy for mashed potatoes.

ingredientList:
1 angel food cake
1 package semisweet chocolate chips
4 tablespoons water
4 eggs
1 cup nuts
2 tablespoons sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
pinch of salt
1 pint whipped cream
recipeText:
Melt Choc Chips in water in double broiler.  When cool, add yolks. 

Beat whites until stiff and fold into chocolate chips mixture.

Add sugar, vanilla, nuts, and whipped cream.

Break cake into pieces and put into a 13 X 9 inch pan.  Pour mixture over cake, making sure it goes between pieces. 

Refrigerate.

ingredientList:
1 angel food cake, baked
1 (10-ounce) package frozen strawberries, or raspberries
1 (3-ounce) package strawberry Jello
1 cup boiling water
2 (8-ounce) packages whipped topping
fresh fruit
recipeText:
Drain thawed strawberries, reserving juice. 

Combine gelatin and boiling water in a bowl. Stir until gelatin is dissolved. 

Add enough water to strawberry juice to measure 1 cup. Stir into gelatin. 

Refrigerate until gelatin is slightly thickened. 

Beat gelatin until foamy and fold together with 1 container whipped topping.

Alternate layers of cake cubes and strawberry mixture into 10 inch tube Pan. 

Press lightly. 

Cover in refrigerator for 4 HOURS. 

Unmold cake into serving plate. Frost sides and top of cake with remaining whipped topping. 

Refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with fresh strawberries and mint leaves.

ingredientList:
1 stick margarine
1 cup flour
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 cup brown sugar
Apple slices
Cinnamon
recipeText:
Line a 9" x 9" x 2" cake pan with apple slices.  

Mix margarine, flour, and sugar.  (Can use 1 cup of sugar instead of 1/2 of each brown and regular sugar.)

Crumble mixture over the apples, and sprinkle with cinnamon.  Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

ingredientList:
5 cups unbleached flour
1 cup whole wheat flour
2 teaspoons salt
1 3/4 cups (or 2 cups) canola oil
7/8 cup water
8 cups peeled, cut, tart apples
4 tablespoons unbleached flour
1 tablespoon cinnamon
1 1/2 cups sugar
1/2 stick butter
recipeText:
